g.text: A browser API that lets websites expose structured tools to AI agents.
Instead of scraping pixels, agents call typed JavaScript functions directly.
Chrome Actions Ring context unlocks structured web interaction
Why WebMCP changes everything for hardware-agent integration
Browser-mediated: Chrome arbitrates all tool access
User consent: "Allow AI to perform [action]?" prompt
SecureContext: HTTPS only, no insecure origins
Window scope: Tools only available in page context
Read-only hints: Tools can declare side-effect-free ops
User interaction: Tools can request user input mid-execution
1. Actions Ring Chrome context can discover site tools dynamically
2. LCD buttons auto-populate with available WebMCP tools
3. Structured calls = reliable one-press actions on any site
4. No vision model overhead = instant haptic feedback
5. First hardware controller with WebMCP integration
6. Works alongside MCP (backend) -- complete agent coverage

svg.text: WISPY CONSOLE // UNIVERSAL AI AGENT CONTROL SURFACE // LOGITECH ACTIONS SDK // HAUSOR LABS 2026
